website_summaries.verdict: Great for those thin, easily portable keyboard for their tablet that's easy to take on the go.
pros: Keyboard is compatible with Android, iOS, and Windows
Rechargeable battery works for 560 hours in standby mode
There is a mouse pad built-in
cons: The Bluetooth technology is a bit outdated
Some complaints about low-quality hinges on the folding mechanism

customer_reviews.title: So cute and easy
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard hooks up to the computer very easily. It is soft to the touch and folds up super neatly. The keys make that fun mechanical key sound that is so sought after these days. I love bringing this with me in case I need a full keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Not secure
customer_reviews.text: First, this keyboard has poor build quality which I'm willing to ignore considering its price. What I'm not going to ignore is the fact that it uses an ancient version of Bluetooth (specifically 3.0) that is highly vulnerable to attacks and shouldn't be considered acceptable for a portable input device. Bluetooth is not the most secure wireless technology to use anyway, but relying on a 10 year old protocol for a device that's likely to be used in public is pretty dumb. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4inc X 6inc & unfolded 4inc x 12inc its smaller then I thought but it works really well.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be a bit bigger, Its small light and works. the only issue i can see is that the T and V key's are smaller than the others, which throws off my typing. If they made it slightly bigger and a bit sturdier this would be a 5 star product. ** Size of the product; Height just slightly under 4 inches width folded 6 inches, unfolded is just shy of 12 inches. **
customer_reviews.author: Josh A.

customer_reviews.title: Great compact ergonomic keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I recently started using a laptop stand when working at my MacBook Air to help with the posture and as it became very uncomfortable to use the laptop built in keyboard, I decided to get myself a compact keyboard. I was deciding between a few options and at first was a little hesitant to go with this particular one due to its tricky set up. I was afraid I won’t get used to it. Im glad I decided to give it a try as it didn’t take me too long to get the hang of it. It seems very sturdy, compact and pairs easily, overall a really great product that I do recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Iredeto

customer_reviews.title: UGHHH! This is going to affect some users and other others, BUUUT
customer_reviews.text: On a traditional keyboard, the B is in the middle of the dang keyboard. Like perfectly nestled in between both sets of home row fingers, easily reachable by both when I type, my B is pressed by my left hand... BUT this keyboard has it on the left and it's killing me. It slows me down so much when just the letter B is needed. I guess that's a small complaint to have, but it really messes up the flow of things since I've been typing this way for at least 20 years. BAH!
customer_reviews.author: VK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard for Desktop-Like Experience With Phone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I used this keyboard/mouse combo on my Samsung Note 8, with a HDMI-USB-C cable. With Samsung DeX, this keyboard is the perfect way to turn your phone into a complete Desktop-like workstation. The buttons are firm as a regular laptop keyboard. The touchpad with mouse buttons is accurate and works well. This keyboard is supposed to work with Windows as well. One problem I found was that I can not charge it while in BT mode, as it thinks it is plugged in to a PC via USB. This didn't prove to be a problem though as the battery life is pretty long. A little pricey still, but I'm sure in time it will come down.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Quality, size and ergonomic design
customer_reviews.text: Just received my keyboard - really like the quality, the touch of the keys and the portability of it. I haven’t travelled with it yet but will very soon. Using it now as i type on my iPad. Like the function keys that allow you to use many of the functions on the iPad without having to touch the screen. Size is perfect as well as the ergonomic design given that i have a spinal injury in my neck where i get pain using a regular keyboard. Excellent value and very happy with it in the short time I’ve had it.
customer_reviews.author: SueB

customer_reviews.title: Really love this keyboard !!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this keyboard!! It can be fold to a really small size which I guess is same as my iPhone7, so it’s really easy to bring into my bag. And the keys are well-touched. Recommend to everyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: I was offered 35$ to delete this bad review
customer_reviews.text: cheep plastic feel. charge indicator just blinks once when pluged in so cant tell if its charging. bluetooth disconects constantly or is flat out unconnectable (bt3.0) the split is in a very bad spot and the layout is not ergonomic at all. you csnt type fast or it misses key strokes
customer_reviews.author: The guilty flea

customer_reviews.title: don't bother with this one
customer_reviews.text: I hesitate to leave a negative comments on what I purchase, but I'm sorry. Since day one, it was uncooperative, the buttons got stuck or slow to type the letters. When I finally gave up, I was a day late to return the item. That is my fault for waiting to the last minute. This product needs to improve the product and not take advantage of customers with their statements of their product.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Probably the worst thing I've bought on Amazon. It won't stay connected via bluetooth for more than 5 minutes, I have to constantly keep turning it on and off and then reconnecting the bluetooth manually. It worked well wired but that defeats the point of having something flexible and portable. The keyboard is small which I wanted but if you have big hands it will be difficult and uncomfortable to type with. Does take getting used to but it wasn't so bad at all. I would like to say I got better use out of it but I kept having to reconnect the device and that hindered both my work output and my overall experience.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pocasangre

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have a Note 9 and DeX Pad. This portable keyboard was intended to complete my easy travel computer set. However, to my disappointment the keyboard frequently would lose connection with the phone. I would have to disconnect and reconnect the bluetooth multiple times when using the keyboard. It was too frustrating so I got another bluetooth keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this when using Samsung DEX by connecting my Note 8 to a portable monitor. I was not expecting a full size keyboard, so the small keys do not bother me. Overall the keyboard works fine and it is very portable. So why only 3 stars? The track pad, while functional, is pretty bad. It's responsiveness is lacking, especially with multi touch, and the left/right buttons are not discrete from the track pad resulting in the mouse pointer jumping locations when pressed. My biggest complaint is that the track pad goes to sleep very frequently and takes a long time to wake back up. Overall it is good in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: Strongly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s really small and easy to carry. I don’t need to bring my heavy computer everyday, I just bring my phone to school and take notes. And it’s easy to connect and use. When i don’t use it, it’ll disconnect and help me save battery. When I need it, I just touch any button, it’ll connect automatically. It’s really cool and nice!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard that could connect to a few more devices
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and that it folds. Even has a track pad for a keyboard that can fold so small. First compact bluetooth keyboard that I don't mind floating around my living room and doesn't stand out as a keyboard when folded. With that being said, It's can't connect to my Samsung TVs. Only knock I have on it. But works with everything else I have so only one start knocked off.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleo Puaa

customer_reviews.title: These do not last
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Jelly Comb folding bluetooth keyboard, and as I come up on 1 year of ownership, like clockwork, keys on the left side are starting to stop working. I love these style of keyboards, but I have to replace these every year because they simply don't last. I only use these a few times a week, maybe it's due to the folding of the board, but sooner or later the keys on the left side begin to degrade to the point where they simply won't work anymore. Try writing a sentence without the letter 'e'. Going with a different brand, if it lasts longer will be worth the additional cost.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Freund

customer_reviews.title: Little keyboard with full-size keys is CUTE and FUN to  use !
customer_reviews.text: I love the Bluetooth and extended battery life. I use my Jelly Comb keyboard all day every day with no problems. I brought it to replace the attachable/detachable keyboard for my Microsoft Surface Pro 2 (2012 manufacture) after its magnetic pins were damaged. I paired the Bluetooth only once, and the tablet and keyboard recognize each other without fail. My Jelly Comb keyboard also works with my Kindle Fire 8HD tablet. The only rough adjustment I've had to manage is pairing the Fn key with other keys to make full use of this sweet little keyboard. I recommend the Jelly Comb Folding Bluetooth keyboard as THE ULTIMATE in replacement and multi-function portability!
customer_reviews.author: Anj in Spokane

customer_reviews.title: Sensitivity is not as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: When I am typing using this keyboard, it missed some letters I typed, so I have to go back and re-type. Bluetooth connectivity is good. The connection is stable and fast. Battery life is something not to worry about, it can be connected wirelessly and wired. I just got it so I didn't have a chance to test the battery life. I gave 3 stars for ergonomic because it was slightly smaller than general keyboard I am using with my computer. However, this problem is something most portable wireless keyboard have. Anyway, I dislike that they have the "V" smaller than other letters on the keyboard, which is annoying,
customer_reviews.author: DarkistVoid

customer_reviews.title: Nifty portable, ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nifty portable, ergonomic keyboard. The size is about the size of a smart phone and can be easily stored in a backpack/bag. I really liked the split and natural layout. Though, the buttons are a little shallow and can require more heavy/intentional pressing. The bluetooth connects easily and smoothly. Unfortunately, I ended up returning it because I decided to buy a full ergonomic keyboard instead - I was looking for a keyboard for at home use rather than to transport and take with me. I don't really have any other use for this, but I would still recommend to others looking for a small, portable keyboard for like a tablet or to carry with while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Knockiie

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of the more ergonomic design of this Bluetooth keyboard, but in short order after buying it I started having issues with the space bar, return and several other keys working intermittently, so I sent it back. Also had issues with it not taking and keeping the mode switch from Windows to iOS. Battery life seemed good and had no connection issue.
customer_reviews.author: nhmtnbkr

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my laptop because I did not want to always be too close to the screen and I did not want to deal with wires and USB space being eaten up, but for the computers, there is some complicated way of pressing certain buttons. An example is the esc button, I have to hold a series of buttons first to press Esc to work. Another con is the touchpad being too small, I can't cover the whole screen with the touchpad because it only controls a small portion of the screen. As for me, i got what i wanted so it not too bad. Good but not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient, USB chargeable, no batteries needed.
customer_reviews.text: Convenient keyboard for tablet or phone. Instant setup, no app install needed. If you frequently take work with you on your phone I definitely recommend giving this handy keyboard a try. A smaller, more portable alternative to those full-sized tablet keyboards like the Logitech ones. Gives my phone the ease of editing and mousing of a full fledged tablet or computer. You even get a track pad and mouse cursor. The only minus is there is no case for it, which would have been nice, even just a cheap stand-in Leatherette case. Best of all, no messing around with those button batteries, it just plugs into micro USB to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher O'Loughlin

customer_reviews.title: Poor key responsiveness
customer_reviews.text: I'm a very fast typist and use a Trent tablet with external keyboard that works so poorly I wanted to try a more portable Bluetooth keyboard. This keyboard was highly rated, so I purchased. It came in on time and I then charged overnight. The keyboard paired with my tablet just fine; however, the key responsiveness was just like the tablet's that I was trying to replace. The keys lagged as well as placed extra periods and spaces randomly, causing me to delete unwanted characters, then the delete key would delete too many characters. In addition, the keys could not keep up with my typing. I cannot use such an inferior keyboard, so am returning it to try something different.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Super Happy! Very functional and convenient bluetooth keyboard. Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a bluetooth keyboard with the mousepad attached and this folding unit is great. I opened box, looked on the instruction booklet page for the buttons and started it right up. The bluetooth paired easily with the lenovo tablet. I was surprised at the size of the small box but when it's unfolded the keyboard measures about about 12" wide by 4" deep by a quarter inch thick. It seems pretty sturdy and the rubber feet on the bottom keep it from slipping or moving around. What I'm thrilled about is the mouse pad which works great. It scrolls nicely and I appreciate not having to look for a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: G. Busher

customer_reviews.title: The mousepad feels cheap and has horrible response
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me type rapidly on my smartphone, and I've found it useful for other Android and PC devices (Apple is garbage ← deal with it). The keys feel cheap and not very clicky like a standard keyboard or typewriter, but the mousepad not only feels cheap, but can be sometimes too responsive, or not responsive enough. Sometimes tapping the mousepad even gently will result in either a left-mouseclick or a right-mouseclick (50-50 chance). The only way to be sure it is a mouseclick of either type is to force depress the mousepad to do your click. Even then, the mousepad sometimes registers the wrong type of mouseclick. Ironically amazing garbage that is made in China.
customer_reviews.author: faididi

customer_reviews.title: No extra doungle to carry just keyboard with built in bluetooth and very portable
customer_reviews.text: First thing its very portable.. easy to carry in a bag... you can charge it to your laptop or desk top and use it parallelly... good thing that bluetooth is built in .. it is very advantage as you need not carry a dongle .. i had another keyboard with a small bluetooth dongle which has to be connected to the system on moving i lost it and tgat keyboard is of no use now.. but with this there is no need to worry... also the mouse is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Dinesh Sai

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good. Using for DeX mode on Galaxy Note 10.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this keyboard today. I'm using it connected to a Galaxy Note 10 in DeX mode. So far, it's working just fine. This keyboard is very small (as is intended) and like other reviewers have mentioned, some keys (T, V and F,) are half size, so there will be no speed typing on this for me. The TouchPad is just as responsive as my laptop TouchPad. But that's OK. I got it for portability and the keyboard/TouchPad Bluetooth combination; and for that it seems just fine. I will update more after I've used this for a while, but the first impression is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great portable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My company laptop has a few keys that haven't been working and have been lazy about replacing it so I got this keyboard. The keyboard has been awesome but I have a few complaints that led me to dock it down a star. Some keys are a bit small due to the location near the crevice of where the keyboard folds so it can be a bit difficult when typing regardless of hand size. Also, the mouse pad is incredibly sensitive and can click things just by scrolling over areas. The great things are that it connects incredibly fast via Bluetooth and the battery life is impeccable. Great product and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Powerful small keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, I’m using it on my new iPad pro instead of buying apple expensive one. It’s great, it connects to Bluetooth really easy, only have to set it up once. Typing is really easy, no sticky or hard keys, and for everyone asking if the touchpad works on the iPad, yes it does!!!
customer_reviews.author: Serena R.

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with This!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard relieve my chronic wrist pain from years of tech work. It's lightweight, easy to carry and the battery life seems to be fantastic. No set up needed and works very well with my MacBook Pro. I tried a sculpt keyboard but with smaller hands find that the mechanical style keys and size tend to increase wrist pain. I am happy I was apple to find a split keyboard with chiclet style keys. For Mac Users: No set-up, works perfectly! It gets annoying that the cmd and windows key are in difference locations, but you can update shortcuts in settings if you prefer.
customer_reviews.author: don't-panic-42

customer_reviews.title: No UBS dongle
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this keyboard so I could take notes in long meetings without wrist strain. I use a wired ergonomic keyboard at my desk with my laptop. However, it clearly states the need to insert the UBS dongle, that it DOES NOT COME WITH, or instructions on how to order one... VERY disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: sgmon

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely 5-star product! And 1-star for me waiting so long to buy it! I struggle with cell phone typing because of a lifetime of gaming and the long term effects on my ancient limbs, and this keyboard is a lifesaver. It folds up thinner than my phone and only slightly wider so it fits remarkibly well in my hip porch, it's full size and the buttons are satifyingly clacky, and I've had it for months now and have not had to charge it once. The only difficulty I've had with it is it struggles to change from one connected device to another, but that's probably user error. This keyboard is abolutely worth the bells.
customer_reviews.author: nytshad

customer_reviews.title: It is NOT made of aluminium!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe there is a metal plate inside, because it's a bit heavy, but besides the hinges everything on the outside is plastic. Also the letters on the caps look like little stickers. The keyboard itself is functional and the typing feel is nice, but only for small hands. I have also the Arteck slim keyboard, which is half the price but looks more premium, with letters laser printed on keycaps and backlight in different colors. And while it's small, the typing feels more like on a regular size. The only advantages of the Jelly keyboard is that in can be connected via USB and it has a touchpad.
customer_reviews.author: A W

customer_reviews.title: light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's fast to connect, and when folded , as small as a iphone 6 , I have ipad , work iphone and my own android phone. convenience to change between the equipment and light weight to put into a pocket. I have no problem typing though some keys are a bit small. but consider it's size and weight, thats's understandable, and the touch pad is also small but just perfect for use.
customer_reviews.author: nikomini

customer_reviews.title: Small, convenient, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Super small as you can see in the pictures but that’s actually why I bought it. The size is convenient. Wifes wallet for scale. I am using this keyboard on a iPad Pro 12.9 2020 version. It connected right away, no issues. the cursor pad works as well as do you mouse buttons. I like the fact that when you are using the mouse cursor it shows a little dot on the screen to where you are moving. now the size you do have to get used to it because it is quite small but again I bought it for the convenience of it being small. Great product and it fits great in my lunch box.
customer_reviews.author: Angel R.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful addition to my media center
customer_reviews.text: We bought this keyboard so that we can have a wireless keyboard and mouse to control a mini pc that is connected to our TV. It works out great because it is both a wireless keyboard and mouse together and I can use it easily on my hands without putting it on a table.
customer_reviews.author: Chris swan

customer_reviews.title: Short range - avoid
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was purchased as a remote keyboatd/mouse combo for a home entertainment system build around an Intel NUC. 1. Construction is flimsy, can't find another way to describe it. 2. Bluetooth 3.0... Enough said. 3. Connectivity is only within a meter of the system rendering the keyboard utterly useless (a Tecknet bluetooth mouse can control the system from a different room). Waste of money - avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed, I started using this with my iPad as soon as I got it and have been using it constantly. It's easy to connect, took maybe 1 sec to connect keyboard to my iPad and connection is strong and constant, no connectivity issues what so ever. It's easy to shift the connection, and portable to carry it along with my iPad, The fold-able keyboard is made of good quality and links used looks to be very dependable. Its small and light enough to comfortably carry it, and comes with a touchpad too, which works with my laptop, overall excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Siddharth

customer_reviews.title: convenient, life quality change
customer_reviews.text: After bought this all in one keyboard, I finally able to laydown on my coach and watch youtube/ play games with my PC connected to my big TV screen. Pros Bluetooth connection Rechargeable! Tiny keyboard elegant looking! Mousepad and left right clicks! Connect to mobile device as well Cons Perhaps too light need good weight metal feeling. Really cant find anything to complain so far! This would be a great holiday gift too, my friends all loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Arial

customer_reviews.title: Compact, functional, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have a tablet that I just use when traveling. This keyboard makes it much easier to type email, do google searches, etc. Pluses: It is sturdy and made out of metal, folds up nicely. It was easy to pair with the tablet. The touchpad is great. Cons: it is not a keyboard that lends itself to touch typing BUT all keys work fine with a firm stroke. It seems to lose the bluetooth connection quite often, power on-off restores it (this could be the tablet's fault ???) I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: TimMor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is small in size, light weight and easy to connect with any device. My husband was given an Ipad for his work and was having a hard time typing on the screen. I picked this one based on the affordable price and great reviews. My husband liked the fact that the touchpad and the keyboard is all in one. It took him few moments to get used to typing while having it on his lap due to it's foldable feature. Overall this product is great and user friendly. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Very cute and portable, but poor functionality.
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wanted to keep this keyboard. It's super cute and folds down so small, I could easily travel with it back and forth to work. However, it created a lot of frustration for me when trying to type a paper because of the two half keys. My fingers got fatigued really fast and it was quite uncomfortable (and not ergonomic) when trying to type without missing the letters on the half keys. If you all could remedy this, I would but it again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: The Retail Therapist

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: My Surface Pro 3 keyboard input port stopped working and I was pretty angry about having to buy a keyboard. But OMG I love it! Compact! Lightweight! Easy to travel with, even more so than the original keyboard. I've only had it a few weeks but the battery life appears decent, but bc it is for my surface which has ausb port I can plug it in instead of using blue tooth so that's not really an issuse for me. Slight learning curve for typing bc of the keys being slightly dispositioned where the keyboard folds. All in all, I love it! Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Danica C

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but not great..
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned the keyboard is very awkward to type on because the buttons are out of place for a normal keyboard. The trackpad is very smooth when it works, but sometimes the bluetooth connection seems to be intermittent causing problems moving the trackpad around. Really unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: We tried...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's laptop because the keyboard stopped working. Worst thing to happen when remote learning. Worked great at the beginning. However a month after the return window closed all the keys from q to p stopped working.School is starting back up and he is doing remote learning again I'm forced to buy a different product. I really wanted to like this produce. I liked that it was compact and small enough for his hands. He liked it as well. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: petiteNOIR

customer_reviews.title: a pain to type on
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a three star, not because it's a bad product. Its just that the key board is small and some and the number keys are so close to each others that my fingers keeps hitting the wrong keys. I'm spending more time looking at the keyboard to make sure that I hit the right number then I should. Also their are several keys that you have to hit real hard to get it to show. Would definitely not recommend this keyboard to anyone who is a fast typist. This keyboard will definitely slow you down.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shipley

customer_reviews.title: The product works but could be better with a few updates
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I purchased this device. While it connects okay. It does go to sleep at times, where you may need to tap the buttons on the keyboard a few times to refresh and wake it up. I left the seller a few suggestions to make this a 5-star product. 1. Add 2 to 3 - 1" inch pop-out feet stands to the bottom to improve the angle to alleviate any carpal tunnel syndrome. 2. Add the "home" and "end" keys. 3. Update to Bluetooth 5.1 standard. I really like the compactability of this product. Keys have descent travel. Other than that, this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Myron Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Good occasional keyboard with trackpad.
customer_reviews.text: Just started using the keyboard today. The build quality is very impressive. I read some reviews before that questioned the build quality but I am not seeing the same issues they seemed to call out yet. The trackpad works well in the most current version of iPad Os. It will really nice to be able to use the track pad to move the curser around for corrections. The one thing that will take some getting used to is the T, D, F, V keys are smaller then the other keys. Since I m not a great home row typer I don’t think I will have an issue with it but it is possible some might.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't died yet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to takes notes and write more efficiently on my iPhone SE. Using an external keyboard causes your onscreen keyboard to remain hidden vastly increasing screen real estate. With this, I can take all my notes on google docs and not have to lug around a laptop to class and back. I really enjoy its ability to fold up and automatically turn on and connect upon unfolding. If you're looking for something small, cheap, functional, and practical, this is a definite buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This little keyboard is awesome. It’s very tiny and compact. It works well with my Lenovo laptop. The only thing is typing is a bit of an adjustment due to the smallness of the keyboard. The mouse pad is great it functions like my Lenovo trackpad and my Mac charger This little keyboard is awesome. It’s very tiny and compact. It works well with my Lenovo laptop. The only thing is typing is a bit of an adjustment due to the smallness of the keyboard. The mouse pad is great it functions like my Lenovo trackpad and my Mac track pad which is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Rae’

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, but quality lacking. "c" key is difficult, other keys randomnly multi-strike.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has a good balance in size between usable ergonomics and ability to fit in a front pants pocket. Tactile feedback is decent. However, right out of the box it had some issues. Sometimes the keys will randomly and intermittently repeat, as if they were sticking or being held down, even though they were only struck once. Furthermore, the "c" key wouldn't respond unless an unusually high amount of pressure was applied to it, making fast typing impossible. I would really like this keyboard if it functioned properly, but I can't recommend it based on the example I received.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Bahr

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working a month in
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a month and have already returned it because it stopped working. It shows a connected but when I type nothing happens. Other problems include: - bluetooth disconnect if you don't type after awhile - if you use a mac, the command key is on the opposite side which makes doing simple shortcuts like copy/paste freaking annoying - the charging is flaky, I needed to hold the connector in place for the charging light to stay on Only pro: it folds so my cats don't accidentally hit something when they walk over it
customer_reviews.author: Cuong K.

customer_reviews.title: It serves its purpose but.....
customer_reviews.text: This is agreatlittle keyboard that fits under myraised computer. Butas you see, it does have a problem with the spacekey. This was noted by other customers. Iam goingto return it and seeif I can get a new one
customer_reviews.author: Nick A.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold bluetooth connection like expected...
customer_reviews.text: But since I got this to work on a laptop that's got keyboard problems it's ... adequate. It does fold down nicely, and when it works it DOES work well, but it seems to shut itself off pretty quickly and you've got to tap a key to get it going again. I could wish it'd have a longer timeout, but I can see how it's required for maximum battery life... One's enough. Won't need another small bluetooth keyboard like this - but if I did, I probably wouldn't get this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, portable, useful  Bluetooth keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I like the keyboard for its portability and usefulness in typing/editing documents on my smartphone. However, there is some lagginess in response when it comes to using the mouse-pad feature. Since the main purpose of a keyboard is to type, and the lagginess is not too annoying, I would recommend the keyboard for text editing on a smartphone or notepad. However, it would not be useful for playing any sort of action game.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz of MicroDesignLabs

customer_reviews.title: "v" and "t" keys are not standard width
customer_reviews.text: They keyboard is a cool idea, the bluetooth is reliable, and the charge lasts forever. So what's not to love? Well, because of the folding design and the way the rows of a keyboard are staggered, the "v" and "t" keys end up being of lesser width than the other keys. You can see this on the picture. This makes it hard for me to reliably touch type. I also find the touchpad to be a bit too small, but that is to be expected given the width of the keyboard. I wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Colannino

customer_reviews.title: Feels ultra breakable
customer_reviews.text: This thing is extremely flimsy and very very plasticy and thin. (It would be fine if it where only 2 of those 3.) Im pretty sure that im gonna end up breaking it with in a few days. Other that I love it. It would nice if you could disable the track pad, my big palms tend to strike it often while typing. Im just going to throw it in my man bag for a backup. DONT try to use this on your lap it needs the support of sturdy surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Don roe

customer_reviews.title: ITS A THING!
customer_reviews.text: It was actually bigger than I thought, which is great! the process of connecting it to a computer, I-pad, and I-phone was easy and smooth. No delay in typing and easy to carry around. I love the size of it because I write short essays for my blog and it was kind of hard to do it outside without a keyboard. I knew there are wireless keyboards which unable to carry. That's why I was so surprised there is a wireless FOLDABLE keyboard to carry around. also one of the good things about this product is battery life. It won't die! I feel it lasts more than 10hrs! It's totally worth it! must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable BT connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: Full battery operations. BT Pairing with Raspberry Pi4B is tiresome. Retaining BT connection very poor or none at all. Touch pad and keys feel and function as expected; when a BT connection is established. Wire connection is solid. A nock-off model (not Jelly Comb) not having the same Touch Pad left/right mouse button functionality obtained . BT connectivity pairs up and stays connected. Much more dependable.
customer_reviews.author: HeR3tic

customer_reviews.title: Not Perfect, but Really Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard mainly for use with a tablet of mine, and also as a spare keyboard incase anything happens to my desktop's keyboard. This bluetooth keyboard is extremely useful, especially when you have the option to plug it into a USB port. Battery life, and bluetooth connectivity is decent with my daily use. However, one of the biggest issues I have with the keyboard is how certain keys require more pressure to be pressed on the center of a key to really register a key press. However, I was able to get used to it, and this keyboard still ends up being a really useful when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Evets

customer_reviews.title: Wanted an easy to store and use keyboard. Finally got it to work on Linux... kinda
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small keyboard that didn't take up much space. It works on windows and linux just fine when its wired. I was finally able to get it working on raspian by doing the following: Pair the keyboard via bluetooth. Open a terminal and download updates by typing: sudo apt-get update Once finished run: sudo apt-get upgrade Reboot. Once in a while the keyboard disconnects. Turning the keyboard on and off fixes the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Owner

customer_reviews.title: Meets the need.
customer_reviews.text: I recently joined the temporary telework community and my employer is not providing laptops and I only have a tablet. I purchased this because typing on a tablet just isn't practical and speech to text was equally frustrating. Additionally, I have children and need to be mobile to set up around what they're doing. This compact keyboard goes from table, to couch, to bed. It does require a hard surface but I just use my notebook in a pinch. . . My only current complaint which could be user error is it closes browser windows when attempting to right click.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: flexible, easy to carry and use, great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I used such a keyboard, which surprised me. It can be folded flexibly while the connections of the three parts are strong. It's cute and easy to carry. It doesn't show great size. I compared it with a normal HP keyboard. It just leaves it in your suitcase and carries it anywhere. It's light. Honestly, you don't want it if you want to type fast. However, it brings you great convenience if you use it sometimes. Its touchpad is also sensitive. Also, it can be connected either by Bluetooth or the USB wire. Again, it's convenient and light. If you want to carry a mobile keyboard, you deserve it at the cost.
customer_reviews.author: wzhend

customer_reviews.title: Awkward keyboard is awkward
customer_reviews.text: The folded size, battery life, portability, weight, etc. of this keyboard are all great. Even the travel of the keyboard is decent. The trouble is the form factor, especially around the fold borders is quite awkward. Some keys are shortened to fit which makes typing a bit awkward. Worse, the keys are a bit insensitive, causing keypresses to get dropped. Overall, makes the keyboard a bit of a miss--at best marginally useful for my purposes :/. Only good for short notes and messaging. Not something on which to author documents.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Not very practical
customer_reviews.text: I went with this version because of the track pad and the ability to plug it in and use it without a charge. It has connected fine and the corded option is really nice. I envisioned this staying in my bad and being pulled out almost dead often, being able to cord connect is works great. Unfortunately, it's main purpose, the keyboard is awful. Having reduced sized keys at the hinges and being undersized to start, makes this really tough to type on. This is a purchase regret.
customer_reviews.author: OneEyedGupy

customer_reviews.title: Returning - NOT reliable
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this portable keyboard, especially since it included a mouse pad. But it was too good to be true. The Bluetooth connectivity is very weak, and often times the keyboard goes into a "sleep" mode where you have to turn off/on the keyboard several times for the Bluetooth to connect again. Can NOT trust this keyboard to do the job, so I am returning and will be on the market for a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Cho

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Easily connects to bluetooth and is easily portable.
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this keyboard and I'm excited to be saying that I'm currently writing this review with the keyboard connected to my phone! I got it with hopes to use alongside my iPad for work, but its so easy to connect that I will start using it on my phone too! I think what I'm most impressed with is that it can be easily portable because it is so small. It is bent a little differently than straight keyboards, but I think that helps with its size. Could easily fit in a pocket, bag or purse. I used my water bottle to show the size. Great product! Excited to be using it. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Nice well sized easy to use keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. The split design makes the smallish keyboard comfortable to type on. Automatically connects to your device up opening (once paired). Letter keys are nearly full size. Magnetic closer seems strong enough, but would have been nice to have a ditty bag/container to secure it for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Speedbark

customer_reviews.title: Keys are too small.
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth connectivity is excellent, and I don't have any issues with battery life. However, it is tough to type as the keys and space between them are too small. It might be expected for such a small portable keyboard, but I believe other options in the market provide a better design. The trackpad is mediocre. I think $25 is a lot for this device, considering its build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Hessam

customer_reviews.title: Compact and light weight
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised that how compact this key board is. It feels like same keyboard as new butterfly keyboard on Mac Pro. Definitely not the best feeling keyboard but considering how compact it is. I will get over it. The connections has no issues. Like Logitech one, turn it on connected. If any con I want to point out, is I hope it comes with a number keyboard as most of laptop don’t have one. And I hope the folding parts can last long.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Chen

customer_reviews.title: Keys sometimes need a little more push to them.
customer_reviews.text: Very good design with keyboard and mouse tied together. For some reason I occasionally have to push just a little harder on keys, not all of them just some. I am sure as I work with it more the tension problem will resolve itself but since I look at the screen when I type I catch them very quickly. I do not think it is a problem with my keyboard, just me and getting used to it.
customer_reviews.author: docbob

customer_reviews.title: A MUST FOR THOSE WHO'D RATHER TYPE THEN SWIPE (AND CORRECT)
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is much better then any previous ones i've had. I haven't used an 'ergonomic' keyboard before, but, i can see why its very helpful, esp. for one who has carpel tunnel (not as much 'stress' on wrist while typing). very portable, of course, since its foldable and not bulky. I haven't had a power issue but, if i 'feel' as if i used it a lot.. will just plug it up. I did notice that i could not use keyboard if texting on FB, however. (strange). Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Shorty62

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact keyboard with glide pad - perfect for tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I had originally ordered this to use with my iPad but found it difficult to set it up with the glide pad - actually have yet to figure it out!! However, it works beautifully with Android based systems. The keys are responsive and the glide pad is very smooth. The keyboard's folding feature makes it safe for transport in my pocket or the mouse pocket in my laptop case. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Bouchard

customer_reviews.title: easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is much smaller and lighter than I expected. If you fold it up, it can be carried easily. It has a trackpad that acts as a mouse, which is especially convenient. Although I bought it to use as a keyboard for my laptop when I am not at home, overall, I think this keyboard is better suited to use as an accessory on a tablet like the ipad. It can be used as a computer keyboard, as long as you can get used to the small keys. The most satisfying thing about it is the long battery life, which I can use for weeks just on a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Convenient to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and very convenient to carry it around. It’s light and small. In terms of convenience, I like it very much. Minor problem is that when it’s unfolded, it will not stay on a horizontal level unless putting it on the table, meaning that it is not meant to use on your lap or soft surface. Besides this, it is overall a good keyboard. It comes with a charger, too.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Functional with several annoyances
customer_reviews.text: Functionally the keyboard worked very good. The design however has some questionable choices. because of where the fold is ZX and c keys are shifted from where they normally are, making touch typing quite difficult. There is also no dedicated escape key you have to hold function and the tilda key at the same time. there is also no dedicated delete key you have to hold function and the backspace key. I had intended to use this keyboard for playing some steam video games on the couch but the lack of these two dedicated keys made many games very frustrating. The keyboard is perfectly functional just does not work well for my intended purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I am doing journaling and use my tablet. This is much easier than the tap tap on my integrated keyboard. No problem with pairing. I don't use it for very long so I can't speak to battery life if you're writing a novel or something. It takes little getting used to the touchiness of the keys. I do wish it had all the conveniences of the internal keyboard. Auto correct, spell check, suggestions and easy punctuation. I love the folding feature!
customer_reviews.author: K. B. O.

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. I do most of my grad school online and in random cafes using an iPad. The keys are a good size, the ergonomic design takes a bit to get used to, but is very comfortable once your hands learn that they can be in their natural position. I've only had to charge it, on average, every 7-10 days. It connects without issue, even if my Bluetooth headset is also connected to the iPad.
customer_reviews.author: A. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Size matters!
customer_reviews.text: Just got my new Bluetooth wireless portable keyboard a few days ago. Yesterday I finally had time to take it out of the box and sync it to my iPad. It literally took seconds. I immediately opened a Word document and typed away. Keyboard is very comfortable and compact. I was able to take my 17” huge laptop off my small desk which I replaced with an 11” tablet with an awesome sturdy free standing case and this perfect sized folding keyboard and now I actually have room to work. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Janet W

customer_reviews.title: Turns my iPad into a laptop
customer_reviews.text: I am not completely sure what the battery life in this Bluetooth keyboard is because I have not allowed it to run completely down, but so far it has lasted a week. It's a bit small and takes some getting used to but I think the challenge of typing on it helps me to stay awake during class so I'll count that as a bonus. I've got no real complaints for it and it fits well into one of the interior pockets on my backpack so I was pleased about that cause it's always easily available. Overall I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon4Me

customer_reviews.title: Good design, could use some improvment
customer_reviews.text: It's compact and foldable, which is great for travel. Bluetooth connection can be inconsistent at times, but it works well for the most part when connected via USB. The biggest challenge is using the finger pad, where two finger swipe to scroll up/down often results in zooming in/out. It also takes a while to get used to having some keys smaller than others.
customer_reviews.author: KCinNYC

customer_reviews.title: Mouse Pad is Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard works fine, but the mousepad is extremely inconsistent. When trying to move slowly, it's just not very accurate. I've been using laptop mousepads for 15+ years, and this is by far the worse one. Also, the oddly shaped T, D, and V keys can make it hard to type if you're accustomed to those keys being the same size (as on every other keyboard)
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good product; hard to connect to PC
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to connect to my pc, and the fault may be with me, but I am still unable to connect it to my PC. It works great with my iPhone, and it is very lightweight. I am able to turn it on and connect it, but not able to type through the pc. Hopefully I can get a friend to help me use it.
customer_reviews.author: maritahenrietta

customer_reviews.title: Super compact but really useful
customer_reviews.text: There's a bit of a learning curve in getting the keyboard connected via Bluetooth and the keyboard is super compact which can be a bit of a physical strain, but if you need to work remotely or on the road, this keyboard is reliable, affordable, and easy to pack. Is it perfect? No. I wouldn't want to spend 8 hours a day on it. But it's certainly good enough for occasional use while traveling. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amy A

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable sturdy keyboard, using with Samsung DexPad.
customer_reviews.text: Nice robust metal case. Good battery life so far. Feels sturdy. Like the touch pad and left click / right click buttons. Works well with my Samsung DexPad. A couple of the letter keys and spacebar being split by the hinges takes some getting used to, but fine after a couple uses. Responsive bluetooth connection good enough for cell phone and tablets. Multifunction keys are a nice added feature but some keys are smaller, again takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: kp20

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Simple, lightweight, and sturdy. I bought this originally to stream pc games through my phone, which this works well for, but I use it a ton for work as well. Since it's both mouse and kb, the only thing I need to log around to work on servers is a Monitor. Is so useful my boss ordered one and might make it part of our kit
customer_reviews.author: Amir Ali

customer_reviews.title: Compact Package
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is amazing! If your looking for a keyboard that can be packed away in a backpack or a purse while still being 100% fully functional you've found the right one! I thought the size would throw me off but I almost instantly got used to the size. This can be paired with a USB-C Hub and a Samsung DEX compatible phone to make a tiny portable PC like experience on the go 👍
customer_reviews.author: 0m3n

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Nice little keyboard. Keys are defined in shape, which is important for me. Side track pad/mouse with the right/left click buttons is great. I think the battery is ok, haven't used it more than an hour or two. Bluetooth connects. It does drop, but not sure if that is this device or my tablet if I don't type anything for a few minutes. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Very portable, even with touch pad
customer_reviews.text: I want to emphasize on its portability. The fact that it's foldable just makes life easier. I especially like the touch pad. May not be the best quality, but means I have one less thing to carry around. Even in this touch-sensitive world, there are times that I need to use mouse functionality. I have not tested the battery life but I'd have to say so far so good. I don't know how much I'll use this device on daily basis. But I'm sure it'll come handy on trips.
customer_reviews.author: pyeonggy

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly Bad (or defective)
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe all the positive reviews for this as the typing experience is shockingly bad. The keystrokes don’t register unless you mash down on the key directly, and even then it’s iffy. I can’t see how anyone would get higher than 25 WPM.
customer_reviews.author: CookieFactory

customer_reviews.title: Works on surface pro 4 / But is a bad keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It works on surface pro 4. First fully charge the keyboard in the first time. Letters T, F and V are smaller and that is difficult for typing. I can not use it connected. It has lag when you type.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Works well with FireTV (but no luck with Samsung TV)
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to make searching and browsing on Amazon Fire Tv easier and it works great with that. Unfortunately my Samsung TV does not find the keyboard maybe expects a different type of Bluetooth, likely more a Samsung problem but still i had hoped it was universal that's why 4 star for Bluetooth, it may not work with some devices...
customer_reviews.author: Philip M.Top Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: It does exactly what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for the battery life, because it hasn;t died on me yet lol. I use it for about a half hour a day for work and have for the last couple weeks. so expect to get at least that much time out of it. downside is the smaller buttons at the hinge. I accept it because there's nothing that can be done about it. but that's the downside
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Vokey

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, easy to use and battery life is good
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. I bought this item for my 7 year old to learning to use keyboards. She uses it with her iPad through bluetooth connection. Surprised for it’s battery life! Since I received the item it’s been a week and my daughter uses it everyday for least an hour period but haven’t needed to charge it yet. I definitely would recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Zaya

customer_reviews.title: Provides a keyboard when the laptop keyboard isn’t working.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this keyboard because the laptop keyboard would either not put the correct letter up or would not put the letter selected up. Of course this was when trying to input the password to get into the computer. This keyboard allowed me to bypass the laptop keyboard and logon to the computer as I needed to. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: KLC54

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to lose connection often, even with the PC being ~5ft away. I like the compact design, I use this with a media PC for TV's and movies so being able to fold down the keyboard/mouse combo is a great idea. But it just doesn't seem to work very well. Connectivity issues persists and honestly the whole thing seems a little flimsy. I'd recommend a full keyboard/touchpad combo if that's what you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard for Apple TV
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small keyboard so I could type in searches in to Amazon, YouTube or Netflix through my Apple TV and this fit the bill perfectly. turn it on, type what you need and it goes into battery save a bout 5 mins later. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ross W

customer_reviews.title: My iPad is -ALMOST- a laptop now
customer_reviews.text: Got this one today, turned it on, paired and it worked PERFECTLY with my iPad mini 5th gen iPadOS 13.3 No need to configure anything. With this combo my iPad does most of what I need a laptop to do an lots that what it can’t I have now the keyboard/ touchpad connected via Bluetooth and I can connect an external drive via USB. Just for the sake of completeness, the touchpad worked right off the bat.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos M. Arenas

customer_reviews.title: Ok product.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like I got an open box, or perhaps a returned product. Didn’t seem to be brand new as the track pad had marks on it. The keyboard function seems ok. Just make sure you lay it on a flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Karim

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this would still be too small and would cramp my hands like the other portable keyboards do but this was perfect. It folds well and is flat enough to drop into a purse. Connects quickly to my ipad and I'm able to type out whatever I need. It spreads apart wide enough to be like an ergo keyboard so it's a really good purchase and worth buying if you need a portable keyboard with ergo support.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

product_meta.title: Foldable Bluetooth Keyboard, Jelly Comb Dual Mode Bluetooth & USB Wired Rechargable Portable Mini BT Wireless Keyboard with Touchpad Mouse for Android, Windows, PC, Tablet-Dark Gray
product_meta.description:
Color:Dark GrayUpdated Version
Jelly Comb Foldable Bluetooth Keyboard With Touchpad Mouse
Are you still worried about dealing with work on the trip? This folding keyboard is the best companion for your travel. You can typing quickly and easily. 

Features:
▶ Foldable design makes the keyboard stylish and practical
▶Automatic sleep function makes it possible to fully utilize the power
▶ Built-in rechargable lithium battery and small power consumption
▶ Sensitive touchpad with left and right buttons and no need extra mouse
▶ Bluetooth and USB wired connection make the foldable keyboard more easy to use
▶ lightweight and portable,you can carry it anywhere

Specification:
Keyboard size: 11.89 x 3.82 x 0.31 inch(Open)
Touchpad size: 2.16 x 1.76 inch
Sleep time: Ten minutes
Working distance: up to 33 feet
Keyboard layout: 63 Keys
Weight: 197.3g

NOTE:
TOUCHPAD can not be used on iOS or Mac OS

Package Included:
1 × Foldable keyboard 
1 × Micro USB cable 
1 × User manual 

Warranty:
Every Jelly Comb product includes 12-month warranty. Please buy with confidence and don’t hesitate to contact us if having any question, we’ll get to you within 24 hours
feature_bullets: ♥TOUCHPAD WITH MOUSE: You can control your device without a mouse with the left and right button of the touchpad. Very convenient and mini size for the user. Note: Touchpad feature is not compatible with iOS devices

♥FOLDABLE DESIGN: Extremely thin and foldable keyboard can be a perfect gift for anyone who often travel or on a business trip. It allows you to operate your mobile devices on the go. Write fast, easy and error-free! It is also a good choice for editors

♥DUAL CONNECTION MODES : You can connect the keyboard with your device via Bluetooth or USB cable. Your device will prioritize to recognize the USB wired mode when you connect at the same time. When you remove the usb cable, the keyboard will automatically switch to bluetooth mode

♥WIDE COMPATIBILITY: With Bluetooth 3.0 technology, the foldable keyboard can work with 3 major operating systems: iOS / Windows/ Android. NOTE: [For Desktop PC Laptop without bluetooth function, you need to use third-party bluetooth adapter (not included) before use]. Folding size: 5.98" x3.82" x0.71"

♥RECHARGEABLE BATTERY & EXQUISITE WORKMANSHIP: Built-in rechargeable battery is more energy efficient. Just two hours of charging, standby time is up to 560 hours. Aircraft grade aluminum for excellent stiffness. It is very durable and has the ability to resist bumps. Sturdy and handy at the same time!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,041 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
